channel.name: o1js RangeError: offset is out of bounds error when adding a function to the contract

messages.content:
I encountered a strange error today and was able to find the change that caused it:

The error appears after I add the new function updatePrivateMap to my MinaNFTContract (src/contract/minanft.ts, lines  187-199). This function is not being called in the code, and the error appears when I call the function of ANOTHER contract MinaNFTMap=Experimental.ZkProgram,  that does NOT use MinaNFTContract (src/minanft.ts:183:27).

To reproduce the error, one can clone the repo https://github.com/dfstio/minanft-lib, use the RangeError branch, and execute 
```
yarn test update.test
```
If one comments the lines 187-199  on src/contract/minanft.ts thus removing the function updatePrivateMap from the contract MinaNFTContract , the test runs without error.

Seems like the size limitation of the contract or the bug in o1js as the code that throws this error does not use at all the function being added or the contract to which the function is being added.

I've tested it on o1js 0.13.1, local blockchain, node 20.8.0, MacBook Pro M2 Max 32 GB, Sonoma 14.0

Any ideas on how to avoid this error?

The text of the error is below:

```
    RangeError: offset is out of bounds
        at Uint32Array.set (<anonymous>)

      at passArray32ToWasm0 (o1js-npm-0.13.1-c58323a2b2-50d802acc5.zip/node_modules/o1js/dist/node/bindings/compiled/_node_bindings/plonk_wasm.cjs:560:24)
      at new WasmFqPlonkVerificationEvals (o1js-npm-0.13.1-c58323a2b2-50d802acc5.zip/node_modules/o1js/dist/node/bindings/compiled/_node_bindings/plonk_wasm.cjs:6659:22)
...
      at Object.prove_ [as merge] (o1js-npm-0.13.1-c58323a2b2-50d802acc5.zip/node_modules/o1js/dist/node/index.cjs:11712:18)
      at Function.generateProof (src/minanft.ts:183:27)
      at MinaNFT.commit (src/minanft.ts:133:49)
      at Object.<anonymous> (test/update.test.ts:35:5)
```
@gregor , could you please look at it?

Update:
If I keep the updatePrivateMap function but remove a few other functions from MinaNFTContract, the error throws later in the code, but also at prover. If I remove another few functions from the MinaNFTContract, the error disappears. Although the contract successfully compiles, it seems like the prover cannot handle this number of constraints. 

Is there any tool or function that allows us to see the number of constraints of the compiled contract, and what are the limitations?

```
    RangeError: offset is out of bounds
        at Uint32Array.set (<anonymous>)

      at passArray32ToWasm0 (o1js-npm-0.13.1-c58323a2b2-50d802acc5.zip/node_modules/o1js/dist/node/bindings/compiled/_node_bindings/plonk_wasm.cjs:560:24)
      at new WasmFqPlonkVerificationEvals (o1js-npm-0.13.1-c58323a2b2-50d802acc5.zip/node_modules/o1js/dist/node/bindings/compiled/_node_bindings/plonk_wasm.cjs:6659:22)
      at verificationEvalsToRust (o1js-npm-0.13.1-c58323a2b2-50d802acc5.zip/node_modules/o1js/dist/node/index.cjs:2420:12)
      at Object.verifierIndexToRust (o1js-npm-0.13.1-c58323a2b2-50d802acc5.zip/node_modules/o1js/dist/node/index.cjs:2511:19)

functions as in methods, or functions you call within methods? try analyzeMethods() on your zkprogram/smart contract to see the amount of constraints you are using , the limit is 2^16
number of @methods in your contract/program shouldnt affect circuit size like this afaik
and the 2^16 is per method for both zkprogram / smart contract, methods are then a part of a ‘wrap circuit’ and there you shouldnt be hitting limitstions afaik
so if your @method code is below 2^16, you should be fine
i'd say lets try an isolate the error, by proving a single @method within a `Mina.transaction`, is the method above the one that fails to prove?
can you point me to `updatePrivateMap` in your repo?

No, it's different, even not from this contract. I've removed the method with 7888 rows that was written just to experiment with MerkleMapWitness on-chain and was not needed for business logic. now everything is working fine!
https://github.com/dfstio/minanft-lib/blob/RangeError/src/contract/minanft.ts#L187

embeds.title: minanft-lib/src/contract/minanft.ts at RangeError · dfstio/minanft-...
embeds.description: MinaNFT TypeScript/JavaScript integration library. Contribute to dfstio/minanft-lib development by creating an account on GitHub.

messages.content: Thanks a lot @maht0rz for help, much appreciated!
can you also point me to where updatePrivateMap was called?
It is not called or used at all
ok so just having it defined as part of the contract, made your proving not work?
Exactly
i dont see anything obvious from the get go when looking at the implementation
you could be hitting the memory limit or something, i heard that 10 @methods per contract is the limit of the wasm prover
Agree, also think so
but you have like 16 methods, we'll see what @gregor says i dont see any reason for the error

It looks like an undocumented limit (or I have missed this part of the documentation) without proper error checking in o1js or some bug with memory or array handling in o1js. 

From the test, it is clear that the error appears due to increasing the contract size. 

Looking forward to @gregor  opinion
wouldnt happen with Protokit 🤨 or it would 😄 we're suspectible to the same errors
do you need to be proving at this stage of development btw?
It's normal, math is complicated))
like.. is all of your logic implemented and you're now switching to proving? i think its pretty inefficient to wait to compile & prove during development

I want to make sure that recursive proofs are working in my setup. I've implemented only half of the logic, starting from easier part, and now, as the code is working, I will add more logic still testing proofs on regular basis to make sure that proofs are not broken by my changes. 

Compiling + proofs generation + merging proofs + verifying + deploying + transactions on local blockchain takes 5 minutes, but I'm just writing the next chunk of the code during this time, so it is in parallel

you should be able to use mock proofs as well, same as snarky does during development for account updates. Back in the day i was able to use dummyBase64Proof API but last time i checked i couldnt figure it out

No, don't want, I use local blockchain with proofs on purpose. Actually, on Polygon I didn't use at all local blockchain and did testing on Mumbai during development (and still on Polygon mainnet there are execution problems that are not present on Mumbai testnet), but with Mina, it is unfeasible due to 3 minutes block. Still, the next plan is to test on Berkeley, it will take probably 30 min for the test, but some new bugs can be caught.

Hey, I'm not surprised, we had this issue with many methods raised internally. It's something that started being observed a couple of weeks ago. Used to work with over 20 methods, now we're seeing problems with something like 10. Will need to be investigated
Thanks @gregor ! I've found how to make it working by removing some functions, and will wait now for the resolution of the problem, Please ping me when it will be fixed, I will test again my repo

I'm also getting a new error: "TypeError: The encoded data was not valid for encoding utf-8" in addition to the previous "RangeError: offset is out of bounds" when I'm trying to compile several contracts referencing each other:
```
TypeError: The encoded data was not valid for encoding utf-8

      at getStringFromWasm0 (.yarn/cache/o1js-npm-0.13.1-c58323a2b2-50d802acc5.zip/node_modules/o1js/dist/node/bindings/compiled/_node_bindings/plonk_wasm.cjs:56:30)

Like last time, if I remove some functions or one contract from compilation, everything is working as expected

hi, @DFST   I ever met it before:
https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1088

embeds.title: circuit compilation fail by some errors · Issue #1088 · o1-labs/o1js
embeds.description: Background: My Machine: 36c, 128GB. My two circuits' size are not small. When I compile them (with node --experimental-wasm-memory64 ), got the errors respectively as blow: TypeError:The encode...

messages.content:
You're using Merkle Trees, which consume thousands of constraints. Have you tried to move Trees to ZKProgram and feed to the SmartContract proof from ZKProgram? 

I'm planning to do it, and I would like to learn from your experience if you have done it already
Interesting discussion re 32-bit  kimchi, thank you @coldStar1993 for this

I got a third type of compilation error today: 
```
    thrown: Array [
      248,
      MlBytes {
        "c": "Stack_overflow",
        "l": 14,
        "t": 0,
      },
      -9,
    ]
```
It occurs only if I compile the ZKProgram contract from https://github.com/dfstio/minanft-lib/blob/master/src/contract/redactedmap.ts  first.
If I compile any other contract before it, everything works as expected.

embeds.title: minanft-lib/src/contract/redactedmap.ts at master · dfstio/minanft-...
embeds.description: MinaNFT TypeScript/JavaScript integration library. Contribute to dfstio/minanft-lib development by creating an account on GitHub.

messages.content: There are no memory issues here; the contract is relatively small and is being compiled first in this case.
Thanks for reporting!
